radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate-sized, reversible perfusion defect in the mid-inferior and basal inferior wall; hypokinesis of the inferior wall; mildly reduced left ventricular ejection fraction of 40 to 49%.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomographic (CT) scan of the chest
radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of clinically significant interstitial lung disease or hilar adenopathy.

Moderately reduced right ventricular function; moderate dilatation of the right ventricle; moderate left ventricular hypertrophy; normal left ventricular size and systolic function; no clinically significant valvular disease.
